metadata.title: CVE-2018-1283 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In Apache httpd 2.4.0 to 2.4.29, when mod_session is configured to forwardits session data to CGI applications (SessionEnv on, not the default), aremote user may influence their content by using a "Session" header. Thiscomes from the "HTTP_SESSION" variable name used by mod_session to forwardits data to CGIs, since the prefix "HTTP_" is also used by the Apache HTTPServer to pass HTTP header fields, per CGI specifications.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
libapache2-mod-macro - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20').
apache2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.20').
